main event: On 23 June 1949, multiple unidentified flying objects were observed in Klamath Falls, Oregon.
interesting points: The objects were described as oval-shaped, similar to dinner plates, and greyish-white in color., Witnesses reported that the objects traveled in a horizontal trail formation at high speeds., The objects made no sound and left no exhaust trails., Two interviews conducted by special agents revealed that the observations lasted between 2 to 4 minutes., The objects performed sharp turns before fading from view.
sighted object: four to five unidentified aerial objects
witness description: One witness was an airport maintenance technician, while the other was a CAA manager, both regarded as reliable.
